title: TOP 10 SNOW REMOVAL MISTAKES TRACTOR OWNERS MAKE

tasks.task: Participate in snow removal with a tractor and equipment.
subtasks: Operate a tractor to clear snow from driveways and parking lots.
Assemble and disassemble a snow pusher attachment.
Adjust plow settings for optimal snow removal.
Replace or sharpen plow edges to maintain proper cutting.
Manage traction on icy or snowy surfaces.
Check and maintain battery charge in cold weather.
Inspect and replace lighting to ensure visibility during operations.
Address potential damage to paved surfaces during snow removal.
Plan and manage storage areas for cleared snow.
Employ appropriate tire choices and weights for snow removal.
Handle possible damage to yard landscaping during snow removal.
Utilize anti-gel treatments for diesel fuel in cold weather.

tasks.task: Assemble and disassemble a snow pusher attachment.
Participate in snow removal with a tractor and equipment.
Check for proper sealing at plow pivot points.
Assess impact on property during snow removal.
Choose appropriate tires and implements for winter.
Start the tractor using glow plugs when necessary.
Protect surfaces from damage during snow removal.
